### Linux x86-64 calling summary  {.smaller}


* first 6 arguments: %rdi, %rsi, %rdx, %rcx, %r8, %r9 

   * floating point arguments: %xmm0, %xmm1, etc.

* additional arguments: push on stack
* return address: push on stack 

   * <code>call</code>, <code>ret</code> instructions assume this

* return value: %rax


### calling convention example  {.smaller}


```
int foo(int a, int b, int c, int d, int e, int f, int g, int h);
...
foo(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8);

```
 
```
pushq   $8
pushq   $7
movl    $6, %r9d
movl    $5, %r8d
movl    $4, %ecx
movl    $3, %edx
movl    $2, %esi
movl    $1, %edi
call    foo
/* return value in %eax */

```
